sentences.en: He came to the fore as a physicist at an early age.
sentences.cn: 他在早年就成了杰出的物理学家.
他是一位著名的物理学家.

sentences.en: He is a physicist of the first rank.
He is famous as a physicist.
He wanted to be a physicist and devote himself to research.
sentences.cn: 他立志要成为一名物理学家,并献身于科学研究.

sentences.en: I think he's a physicist or something of that nature.
sentences.cn: 我想他大概是物理学家或那一类的人.

sentences.en: Make much mathematician, physicist, astronomer wait to be enrolled to enter Microsoft.
sentences.cn: 许多数学家 、 物理学家 、 天文学家等被招进微软.

sentences.en: Many possibilities which are open to the physicist today were impracticable not long ago.
sentences.cn: 今天向自然科学家提供的可能性,在不久之前还是行不通的.

sentences.en: Statics, the physicist knows, is only an abstraction from dynamics.
sentences.cn: 物理学家知道, 静力学只是动力学的一种抽象.

sentences.en: The best known is the Nicol prism, invented in 1828 by the Scottish physicist William Nicol.
sentences.cn: 最有名的是尼科耳棱镜, 1828年由苏格兰物理学家尼科耳所发明.

sentences.en: The most renowned birefringent polarizer was introduced in 1828 by the Scottish physicist Nicol.
sentences.cn: 最著名的双折射起偏器是由苏格兰物理学家尼科耳在1828年发明的.

sentences.en: The physicist fudged on his experimental data.
sentences.cn: 那位物理学家捏造实验数据.

sentences.en: The physicist was aware of the potential danger of nuclear fusion.
sentences.cn: 那位物理学家意识到核融合潜在的危险.

sentences.en: The successful physicist never puts on airs.
sentences.cn: 这位卓有成就的物理学家从不搭架子.

sentences.en: This relationship is called Boyle's law, in honor of the English physicist who discovered it.
sentences.cn: 为纪念发现这一定律的英国物理学家, 这个关系式叫做波义耳定律.

words.tran_cn: [物] 物理的；身体的；物质的
地文学，地相学；自然地理学；自然现象志

trans.tran_en: a scientist who has special knowledge and training in  physics
